clinical_study.brief_title: Integrating Family Planning Into Postabortion Care
clinical_study.official_title: ESD: Integrated Services for Women Seeking Postabortion Care in Kenya

brief_summary.textblock: A descriptive post-intervention study designed to provide data to decision-makers at the Kenyan Ministry of Health, the Extending Service Delivery Project (ESD), and Pathfinder International about whether and how to scale-up the ESD Project's postabortion care (PAC) services package. Approximately three months of data will be collected following the introduction of postabortion care job aids in eight public sector health facilities in Central Province and Nairobi, Kenya. Postabortion clients and providers will be interviewed; facilities providing PAC services will be inventoried using facility checklists.

detailed_description.textblock: A descriptive post-intervention study designed to provide data to decision-makers at the Kenyan Ministry of Health, the Extending Service Delivery Project (ESD), and Pathfinder International about whether and how to scale-up the ESD Project's postabortion care (PAC) services package. Approximately three months of data will be collected following the introduction of postabortion care job aids in eight public sector health facilities in Central Province and Nairobi, Kenya. Postabortion clients and providers will be interviewed; facilities providing PAC services will be inventoried using facility checklists.

primary_outcome.measure: Knowledge, attitudes, and practice regarding PAC job aids (clients and providers)

secondary_outcome.measure: Client-report of provider counseling, by client age

intervention.intervention_name: Provision of PAC job aids and provider training on the use of the job aids
intervention.description: Facility-level intervention applied to all study facilities

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- For Facilities: APHIA II facilities supported by the ESD project in Central Province and Nairobi, Kenya where: (1) PAC services are provided, (2) at least one provider has received PAC and Youth-friendly PAC training, (3) Community mobilization has been initiated, (4) PAC equipment and supplies have been procured, (5) PAC job aids have been distributed.
- For Clients: Women aged 15 years or older who have received PAC services at a study facility and who have a telephone on which they can be contacted
- For Providers: Any person who offers PAC services at a study facility

responsible_party.name_title: Cate Lane Senior Youth Health Advisor
